messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Help me collect the basic electoral information of 50 U.S. states in 2024. 1) the number of congressional districts; 2) number of electors; 3) the name of the governor in 2024 and his/her party affiliation, like "Gavin Newsom (D)"; 4) the names of the two senators in 2024 and their party affiliations separately.

Please present the information in one Markdown table with these column headers: State, Number of Congressional Districts, Number of Electors, Governor (Party), Senator 1 (Party) & Senator 2 (Party) 

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.

For example, 
```markdown
| State           | Number of Congressional Districts | Number of Electors | Governor (Party)     | Senator 1 (Party)& Senator 2 (Party) |
|-----------------|-----------------------------------|--------------------|----------------------|-------------------|-------------------|
| Alabama         | 7                                 | 9                  | Kay Ivey (R)         | Tommy Tuberville (R)& Katie Britt (R)   |?

<think>
To begin, I need to gather information about each state's number of congressional districts, electors, governors with their party affiliations, and senators with their party affiliations for the year 2024. This is quite extensive, so I'll start with searching for the first piece of data.
</think>
<search> number of congressional districts per state </search>

Search query: number of congressional districts per state
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_United_States_congressional_districts):
List of United States congressional districts - Wikipedia The number of voting seats within the House of Representatives is currently set at 435, with each one representing an average of 761,169 people following the ...

[Doc 2](https://www.britannica.com/topic/United-States-House-of-Representatives-Seats-by-State-1787120):
Number of U.S. House of Representatives Seats by State - Britannica After the 2020 census, six states gained seats in the House: Colorado, Florida, Montana, North Carolina, and Oregon each gained one, and Texas gained two.

[Doc 3](https://www.visitthecapitol.gov/sites/default/files/documents/resources-and-activities/CVC_HS_ActivitySheets_CongApportionment.pdf):
[PDF] How Your State Gets Its Seats: Congressional Apportionment Apportionment refers to the way the number of Representatives for each state is determined every 10 years, as required by the Constitution, following a ...

Search query: number of electors per state
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.archives.gov/electoral-college/allocation):
Distribution of Electoral Votes | National Archives Allocation among the States Electoral votes are allocated among the States based on the Census. Every State is allocated a number of votes equal to the ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Electoral_College):
United States Electoral College - Wikipedia In the United States, the Electoral College is the group of presidential electors that is formed every four years for the sole purpose of voting for the ...

[Doc 3](https://www.britannica.com/story/how-many-electoral-college-votes-does-each-us-state-have):
Electoral Votes by State | Infographic - Britannica How Many Electoral College Votes Does Each U.S. State Have? Every U.S. presidential election is determined by the electoral college. Find out how many votes ...

Search query: governors and party affiliations for 2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_current_United_States_governors):
List of current United States governors - Wikipedia The United States has 50 states and 5 territories that each elect a governor to serve as chief executive of the state or territorial government.

[Doc 2](https://www.nga.org/governors/):
Current Governors - National Governors Association The National Governors Association provides informative gubernatorial resources, including current Governors' biographies and terms in office.

[Doc 3](https://governors.rutgers.edu/fast-facts-about-americas-governors/):
Fast Facts About America's Governors There are currently no Independent or third party governors in the U.S.. Partisan Control of Government. State Legislature. Governor, Democratic, Republican ...

Search query: senators and party affiliations for 2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.senate.gov/senators/):
U.S. Senate Information about Current Senators. Party Division 119th Congress • Majority Party: Republicans (53 seats) • Minority Party: Democrats (45 seats)

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_Senate_elections):
2024 United States Senate elections - Wikipedia ·. Green tick. Y Rick Scott (Republican) 55.57% · ·Debbie Mucarsel-Powell (Democratic) 42.79% · ·Ben Everidge (Independent) 0.6% · ·Feena Bonoan (Libertarian) 0.5% ...

[Doc 3](https://www.senate.gov/senators/SenatorsRepresentingThirdorMinorParties.htm):
Senators Representing Third or Minor Parties - U.S. Senate This list provides the names, service dates, and political party affiliation of the Senate's many independent members.
